chapter.title: Functions
chapter.para: For each product, there is a module that enables you to initiate, amend, and monitor trades on behalf of your company.
These modules all have similar sets of functions. The basic functions found in all these modules are described in this chapter.
For basic features common to all modules, such as basic terminology and the behaviour of lists, see chapters Introduction and Getting Started.

section.title: Portlets
section.para: The Recent Pending Transactions and Recent Notifications lists within the Trade Events portlet on your home page show recent events in all modules. These lists are provided by the module. See chapter Calendar Module for details.

section.title: Validation and Submission
section.para: Two types of validation are done when you fill in an input form.
First, each field is validated as you enter it. Errors that can be detected by local validation of the field are indicated by a popup message as soon as the cursor leaves the field.

When you have completed a form and you click Submit, the form is checked to ensure that all mandatory fields are filled in. If not, you get an error message and the first uncompleted mandatory field is highlighted.

section.title: Main Menu
section.para: The main menu of is down the left-hand side of your home page. It consists of links to the menus for the individual modules.
The number of items on the main menu therefore depends on which modules you have permissions for.

section.title: Functions
section.para: This section lists the basic functions that you will find in a typical module. You enter the menu for a module by clicking the appropriate link on the main menu on your home page. The functions in the module for a particular product type handle only that product type. Only products for your own company are shown - you never see products for other companies.

The rest of this chapter describes these basic functions. The names of these functions may differ slightly between modules, and some modules may have other functions besides these, or not have all of these. These differences are described in the chapters for the individual modules.

In many cases the name of the function or set of functions includes the name or abbreviation for the product handled by the module. For example, in the Letter of Credit (LC) module, the menu item shown here as Initiation is LC Initiation.
In this chapter, where it is necessary to include the product type we call it product-type. Thus, in the LC module, product-type is LC.
These are the basic functions:

listitem.para: Set of functions for creating a request to initiate a product, and submitting the request to the bank.
Set of functions for creating a request to amend a product, and submitting the request to the bank.
Set of functions for creating a free-format message regarding a product, and submitting the message to the bank. In some modules this is called Update.

Function to display a list of your company's pending transactions; that is, those that are have Draft or Unsigned status or are awaiting a reply from the bank. You can open transactions to edit or submit them.
Function to display a list of products initiated by your company, so you can view their details and optionally print a hard copy of these details.
Set of functions to carry out maintenance tasks, including deleting outdated transactions.

section.title: Operations
section.para: Most functions display a form, with buttons which you click after filling it in. These buttons are as follows. These buttons do not all appear on every form.

entry.para: Operation
Description
Save the transaction as a draft, so that you or another user can continue to work on it later. No validation is done. It is not sent to the bank.

If you do not have sufficient permissions (for example, to handle the amount you have requested), you get an error message and the transaction is not sent. Its status becomes Unsigned.

section.title: Initiation Functions
section.para: The Initiation part of the menu contains functions for creating a product initiation and submitting it to the bank.

section.title: From Scratch
section.para: Create a product initiation from scratch and optionally send it to the bank. In some modules, you can alternatively save it as a template, from which such initiations can be created.

This function displays an input form for describing the details of the product requested. You use this form to create your initiation and validate it, save it as a draft, submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority), or save it as a template.
The input form is different for each product. For detailed descriptions of these input forms, see the chapters for the individual products.

section.title: From Template
section.para: Create a product initiation from a template and optionally submit it to the bank.

This function displays a list of initiation templates created by users in your company. You can modify a template by clicking its Edit
icon, or delete it by clicking its Delete
icon.

Click in the Reference column to display the same input form as for From Scratch, but initialised with the data from the template. You use this form to create your initiation and validate it, save it as a draft, submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority), or save it again as a template.

section.title: Copy From
section.para: Create a product initiation from an existing product of the same type.
This function displays a list of your company's existing products - that is, those that have been approved by the bank in response to an initiation request from your company..

Click in the System Id column to display the same input form as for From Scratch, but initialised with the data from the existing product. You use this form to create your initiation and validate it, save it as a draft, submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority), or save it as a template.

section.title: Retrieve Draft
section.para: Continue working on a product initiation that you or another user have already started and saved.
This function displays a list of Draft or Unsigned product initiations created by users in your company.

Click in the System Id column to open the initiation for further editing, after which you can again validate it, save it as a draft, submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority), or save it as a template.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: Submit to the bank a product initiation that you or another user have previously started but been unable to submit.
This function displays a list of Unsigned product initiations created by users in your company.

Click in the System Id column to display a read-only summary of the initiation, from where you can submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority). You cannot edit the initiation from this function.

You can submit multiple initiations in a single operation directly from the list. Click the box at the beginning of a row to select the row, then click Submit at the end of the list to submit all the selected initiations. The system will check that you have authorisation for multiple submissions.

section.title: Amendment Functions
section.para: The Amendment part of the menu contains functions for creating an amendment to an existing product, and submitting the amendment to the bank.

section.title: From Existing
section.para: Create an update for an existing product, and optionally submit it to the bank.
This function displays a list of your company's existing products - that is, those that have been approved by the bank in response to an initiation request from your company..
Click a row to open an input form.You use this form to create your update and save it as a draft or submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority).
You cannot open a product from this list if its status is Cancelled.
The input form is different for each product. For detailed descriptions of these input forms, see the chapters for the individual products.

section.title: Retrieve Draft
section.para: Continue working on an update that you or another user have already started and saved.
This function displays a list of Draft and Unsigned updates created by users in your company.
Click a row to open the update for further editing, after which you can save it again, or submit it (if you have sufficient authority).

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: Submit to the bank an update that you or another user have previously started but been unable to submit.
This function displays a list of Unsigned updates created by users in your company.
Click a row to display a read-only summary of the update, from where you can submit it to the bank if you have sufficient authority. You cannot edit the update from this function.

section.title: Message to Bank (or Update)
section.para: The Message to Bank (called Update in some modules) part of the menu contains functions for creating an free-format message regarding an existing product, and submitting the message to the bank.

section.title: From Existing
section.para: Create a message regarding an existing product, and optionally submit it to the bank.
This function displays a list of your company's existing products - that is, those that have been approved by the bank.
Click a row to open an input form.You use this form to create your message and save it as a draft or submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority).
You cannot open a product from this list if its status is Cancelled.

section.title: From Discrepant
section.para: Create a message in response to a reporting message from the bank, and optionally submit it to the bank.

This function displays a list of your company's products for which there is a message waiting from the bank, of type Discrepancy Response. For a message of this type the bank requires an answer from your company.
Click a row to open an input form.You use this form to create your message and save it as a draft or submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority).

section.title: Action Required
section.para: Create a message in response to a reporting message from the bank, and optionally submit it to the bank.

This function displays a list of your company's products for which there is a message waiting from the bank, of type Customer Instructions, Consent Response, or Amendment Response. For a message of any of these types the bank requires an answer from your company.
Click a row to open an input form.You use this form to create your message and save it as a draft or submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority).

section.title: Retrieve Draft
section.para: Continue working on a message that you or another user have already started and saved.
This function displays a list of Draft and Unsigned messages created by users in your company.
Click a row to open the message for further editing, after which you can save it again, or submit it (if you have sufficient authority).

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: Submit to the bank a message that you or another user have previously started but been unable to submit.
This function displays a list of Unsigned messages created by users in your company.
Click a row to display a read-only form showing the message, from where you can submit it to the bank if you have sufficient authority. You cannot edit the update from this function.

section.title: Inquiry and Maintenance
section.para: This section describes the inquiry and maintenance functions found in the Pending, Inquiry, and Maintenance parts of the menu.
First we describe the Output Format field, common to several of these functions.

section.title: Output Format
section.para: Some functions in this part of the menu have a feature to let you choose the destination and format of the lists they display.
Below the search criteria fields is an Output Format field, where you select the destination and format from a dropdown list:

listitem.para: Screen (default) displays the list on the same web page, in the normal list format.
CSV downloads the report to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or SpreadSheet option to export the list as a report, so you can use it or customize it in your office productivity tools. When you click Search, the browser displays the File Download prompt, where you can choose to save the file or open it. Opening it launches Excel if it is available on your workstation.

section.title: Pending
section.para: Check the status of pending transactions, and optionally edit or submit them.
This function displays a list of your company's transactions that are pending - that is Draft, Unsigned, or awaiting a reply from the bank.
The Type column in the list shows the type of transaction:

listitem.para: New (an initation)
Amend (an amendment)
Message (a free-format message)

section.para: The Status column shows the current state of the transaction:

listitem.para: Incomplete (Draft)
Uncontrolled (Unsigned)
Submitted (awaiting a reply from the bank)

section.para: Each transaction is shown with one or two of the following three action icons, depending on its status:

entry.para: Symbol
Description
Open the transaction to edit it (same as selecting it in Retrieve Draft). This button is present on transactions with Incomplete (Draft) or Uncontrolled (Unsigned) status.
Open the transaction in non-editable form to submit it to the bank (same as selecting it in Retrieve Unsigned). This button is present on transactions with Uncontrolled (Unsigned) status.
Open a popup window displaying the details of the product. This button is present on transactions that have been submitted to the bank.

section.title: Inquiry
section.para: Check the status, details and history of products.
This function displays a list of your company's existing products - that is, those that have been approved by the bank.
The Status column shows the current state of the product and can have the following values:

listitem.para: New is the state of a product after its successful initiation,
Amended is its state after an amendment has been applied,
Updated is the generic state generally given by the bank as a follow-up to a free format message.

Other statuses are available on the bank side and can be used freely by its Trade Services team when generating a Bank towards Client transaction (see the User Manual - Bank for further details on the bank reporting features). Hence the state of a transaction record could be Accepted, Settled, Cancelled, Extended or Purged.

section.para: Each record is shown with two action icons:

entry.para: Symbol
Description
Open a popup window displaying the current details of the product.
(History) Display the Product Dashboard, described in section Product Dashboard.

section.title: Maintenance
section.para: The functions in this part of the menu carry out various maintenance tasks.

note.para: Deleted records are physically removed from the system. Deletions should therefore be done with great care!

section.title: Set Entity
section.para: Only present if your company has entities.
Assign an entity to a product that currently has none.

This function displays a list of products that have no entity assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign an entity. All transactions of the selected product are updated.
No particular permissions are needed for this action.

section.title: Set Reference
section.para: Assign a customer reference to a product that currently has none.

This function displays a list of products that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign a reference. All transactions of the selected product are updated.
No particular permissions are needed for this action.

section.title: Unsigned
section.para: Delete Draft or Unsigned transactions that are out of date and will never be submitted.
This function displays a list of Draft or Unsigned transactions.

Click rows to select them (click anywhere in the row - a tick appears at the left-hand end), then click Delete selected transactions at the end of the list to delete them. The system will check that you have sufficient authorisation.

section.title: Purged
section.para: Delete purged transactions.
This function displays a list of transactions that have been marked as Purged by the bank.

You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use it for inquiry purposes, or as a basis for a new transaction using the Copy from function, if the module has such a function.

Click rows to select them (click anywhere in the row - a tick appears at the left-hand end), then click Delete selected transactions at the end of the list to delete them. The system will check that you have sufficient authorisation.

section.title: Rejected
section.para: Delete rejected transactions.
This function displays a list of transactions that have been rejected (marked as Not Processed) by the bank.

You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use it for inquiry purposes, or as a basis for a new transaction using the Copy from function, if the module has such a function.

Click rows to select them (click anywhere in the row - a tick appears at the left-hand end), then click Delete selected transactions at the end of the list to delete them. The system will check that you have sufficient authorisation.

section.title: Product Dashboard
section.para:
When you click
in a row in the list displayed by the Inquiry function, a page is displayeed giving full details of the product whose row you clicked. This page is called the Product Dashboard. It shows a number of portlets:

listitem.para: Consolidated Summary View
Basic reference information about the product, for example its system ID.
Outstanding
Graph showing amount outstanding
Actions
Menu of links to initiate appropriate actions or related new products directly from this page.
History
List of events on this product. Click Switch to thread history or Switch to standard history to switch between two views.
Pending Transactions
List of transactions on this product that are pending. This is just like the list described for the Pending function (see section Pending), but has entries for the one product only.
Consolidated Charge View
List of consolidated charges.
List of Attachments
List of items attached to transactions on the product. You can click on a row in the list to download an attachment.

section.title: History Report
section.para: In the History portlet within the Product Dashboard, you can click in the Release date column to open a popup window showing full details of each event. Within the popup, the Event Details section shows the key details of the event. It shows any additional instructions and attachments added by users at your company, and the bank's comments and attachments given in reporting messages.
Here are some examples covering various types of transaction:

listitem.para: For an initiation, a summary of details of the new product, such as the system and reference numbers, the amount and dates are shown. The system also displays the full set of data submitted by a user at your company to initiate the product.
For an amendment, only the information related to the amendment itself is shown, such as the increase of amount, a new expiry date or tolerance.
For a message from the bank to the client, only a reminder of the references and the type of transaction (Reporting) are displayed, together with the instructions and comment text fields.

section.para: If the Event Details header in the popup window shows a Release Date/Time, it means the time the validated transaction event was released by your company to the bank.
The Date/Time field that accompanies a Bank Message header means the time the reporting message was released by the bank to the customer.
You can also export the history report as an external file in PDF format, by clicking Export.
